Description: Neck and body sherd of East Greek pottery column-krater; interior black with two bands in added red near top of sherd; exterior: neck black; below, black-figure decoration consisting of swan to right (head, neck and chest with red dots, and part of back remaining); to left, part of undetermined motif.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 37, pl XVIII, no. 35)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 63, no. A38, pl. CXIII)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.981)
